content.description:
Consider the following procedure.

Procedure Call
Explanation

DrawLine (x1, y1, x2, y2)
Draws a line segment on a coordinate grid with endpoints at coordinates (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)

The DrawLine procedure is to be used to draw the following figure on a coordinate grid.

The following code segment is intended to draw the figure.

startX <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 2

startY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 6

endX <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 8

endY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 8

REPEAT 4 TIMES

{

<MISSING CODE>

}
content.question: Which of the following can be used to replace <MISSING CODE> so that the figure is drawn correctly?

choices.label:
DrawLine (startX, startY, endX, endY)
endY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endY - 2

DrawLine (startX, startY, endX, endY)
endX <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endX - 2
endY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endY - 2

endY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endY - 2
DrawLine (startX, startY, endX, endY)

endX <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endX - 2
endY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endY - 2
DrawLine (startX, startY, endX, endY)

content.answer:
DrawLine (startX, startY, endX, endY)
endY <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> endY - 2

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Use abstraction to manage complexity in a program.
